description: This indicates a Service PIC has entered a more severe memory-usage
zone from a less severe memory usage zone. The zone entered
is identified by jnxSpSvcSetIfMemoryZone.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetZoneEntered JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetIfMemoryZone i 1 JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetIfTableName s EXAMPLE

description: The memory-usage zone currently occupied by this Service PIC. The
definitions of each zone are:
Green - All new flows are allowed.
Yellow - Unused memory is reclaimed. All new flows are allowed.
Orange - New flows are only allowed for service sets that are
using less than their equal share of memory.
Red - No new flows are allowed.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetIfMemoryZone

description: The ifName of the interface identifying the Service PIC. If more
than one interface is associated with the Service PIC, the name
associated with the lowest layer interface is used for this object.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetIfTableName

description: This indicates a Service Pic has exited a more severe memory-usage
zone to a less severe memory usage zone. The zone exited is
identified by jnxSpSvcSetIfMemoryZone.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetZoneExited JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetIfMemoryZone i 1 JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetIfTableName s EXAMPLE

description: The memory-usage zone currently occupied by this Service PIC. The
definitions of each zone are:
Green - All new flows are allowed.
Yellow - Unused memory is reclaimed. All new flows are allowed.
Orange - New flows are only allowed for service sets that are
using less than their equal share of memory.
Red - No new flows are allowed.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetIfMemoryZone

description: The ifName of the interface identifying the Service PIC. If more
than one interface is associated with the Service PIC, the name
associated with the lowest layer interface is used for this object.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetIfTableName

description: This indicates a Service Pic has exceeded its internal threshold
for CPU utilization (85%).

event.Summary: CPU utilization of Service PIC is $v1 %

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetCpuExceeded JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetIfCpuUtil u 9999 JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetIfTableName s EXAMPLE

description: The amount of CPU used by this Service PIC, expressed as a
percentage of the total.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetIfCpuUtil

description: The ifName of the interface identifying the Service PIC. If more
than one interface is associated with the Service PIC, the name
associated with the lowest layer interface is used for this object.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetIfTableName

description: This indicates a Service Pic has crossed below its internal
threshold for CPU utilization (85%).

event.Summary: CPU utilization of Service PIC is $v1 %

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetCpuOk JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetIfCpuUtil u 9999 JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetIfTableName s EXAMPLE

description: The amount of CPU used by this Service PIC, expressed as a
percentage of the total.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetIfCpuUtil

description: The ifName of the interface identifying the Service PIC. If more
than one interface is associated with the Service PIC, the name
associated with the lowest layer interface is used for this object.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetIfTableName

description: This indicates a Service Set has reached its upper limit of flows
threshold of a maximun flows allowed for a service set.

event.Summary: Service set $v2 flow limit reached $v1 % of maximum threshold

description: The Total no of flows present in this Service Set, expressed as a
percentage of the total maximum flows.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetFlowLimitUtil

description: The Service Set name.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetNameUtil

description: This provides TCP logging host connection status for Service Set.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpTcpLoggingHostStatus JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpTcpLoggingHostIpaddr s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpTcpLoggingHostPort i 9999 JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpTcpLoggingHostConnStatus s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpTcpLoggingHostRoutingInstance s EXAMPLE

description: The TCP logging remote host server IP address.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpTcpLoggingHostIpaddr

description: The TCP logging remote host server port number.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpTcpLoggingHostPort

description: The TCP logging remote host server connection status.
Status can be either <connection established> or
<connection dropped>
variables.name: JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpTcpLoggingHostConnStatus

description: The routing instance name under which TCP logging
remote host server is configured.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpTcpLoggingHostRoutingInstance

description: This indicates a Service Set has reached its upper limit of flows
threshold of a maximun flows allowed for a service set.

event.Summary: Service set $v2 flow limit reached $v1 % of maximum threshold

description: The Total no of flows present in this Service Set, expressed as a
percentage of the total maximum flows.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetFlowLimitUtil

description: The Service Set name.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SP-MIB::jnxSpSvcSetNameUtil
